intro: Adenostyles leucophylla, commonly known as the white-leafed adenostyle, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has narrow, silvery-gray leaves that help reduce water loss. Its flowers are small and clustered, often appearing in late summer to early fall. The species is valued for its ornamental appeal and its ability to thrive in arid environments.
